Comments: I can't imagine any teachers aren't using scholastic book clubs, but if they were, I would 100% suggest they do!
Majority of the books I ordered got cancelled at the last minutes despite placing the order early. If the stock changes consistently, it should be notified sooner. Very disappointed.
The response came so quick for my email. I really appreciate how professional and easy it was to get my situation fixed.
No on respond to my request submitted via the website. I got the standard we got your message email and then the email Asking for feedback. Thatâ€™s it. Kind of disappointing

My email seems to be hung up in your system.  Every time I sign in I get an error message telling me to try again later or to call.  I have tried for three days.  I wanted to place a class order, but cannot get the email issue resolved.  I asked for the password reset link but it didn't work.  I have called and done the chat.  I give up.

It would have been nicer to have the book that was unavailable listed as such before I tried to order it. Now the teacher has submitted the order and I'm without the item I wanted for my student's birthday. You shouldn't be overselling items.

Please stop selling Roald Dahl books. This is just one of his many quotes, ""there is a trait in the Jewish character that does provoke animosity. ... Even a stinker like Hitler didn't just pick on them for no reason."

I included the Media Specialist name on the PO and it caused confusion. I am the secretary/treasurer and place all the orders. It was for my own use to know where to deliver the books. I got a reply saying she did not have an account set up. In the future, I will only use my name. Do I need to resubmit the order with just my name on it?
I received extra books but I haven't heard from Scholastic at all.
I was pleasantly surprised by your customer service. I emailed in a concern, Received a response very quickly, and then fixed the issue all within a few hours. Exceeded expectations!

I submitted a flaw. I got an explanation, but did not get any validation that "working as intended" is valid. There's a huge problem with submitting an order for two children and one of the orders "disappearing" when one teacher submits. Furthermore, instead of validation that it is a huge design flaw that needs to be fixed, the person who responded told me that I needed to contact the teacher because if she didn't submit on time, an item would expire??? What kind of customer service is that. I don't own the teacher. If anything, you all create a relationship with the classrooms to make sure your system works. There is something innately broken if the system you set up allows me to order something that... "expires" because a teacher doesn't submit. And the only way I'd have found out is by contacting because I was trying to help identify a bug on your website... or I ultimately could have just not received that portion of the order. And if that is a problem, why isn't the onus on you all as a company to contact the teacher? What a mess. I got my orders submitted, but definitely lost trust in the company. If your website isn't ready to handle basic needs of an ordering and shipping system, then don't deploy it. Fix it.

I have been unable to access my account which I have had for years. I am unable to use the phone due to a hearing issue. I have gotten responses quickly but still do not have access to online orders or  my bonus points. I had problems with Scholastic News last year but that did finally get resolved and seems ok this year.
It just took a long string of emails for someone to finally answer my question that I posed in my first email. It wasn't a complicated question.
The live chat works much better. It took 2 people to give me the right answer. I am glad it is all good now!
I appreciate the quick response time. My concern was understood and addressed. Thank you.

Please simplify your website. Ordering isn't easy.  When I have points to use.  I would like to see the book cover, (not just the title) and points together.  My time is limited, and it takes a really long time to order.  Please automatically send me flyers, send me an email asking if i want them, or have a place to request flyers on your website.  If it is there a place, I am not able to locate it. I didn't talk to anyone. I filled out a survey with a problem and I received an email back right away.  My issues are more about the website and how difficult it is to maneuver.  Thanks!

Please simplify your website. Ordering isn't easy.  When I have points to use.  I would like to see the book cover, (not just the title) and points together.  My time is limited, and it takes a really long time to order.  Please automatically send me flyers, send me an email asking if i want them, or have a place to request flyers on your website.  If it is there a place, I am not able to locate it. I didn't talk to anyone. I filled out a survey with a problem and I received an email back right away.  My issues are more about the website and how difficult it is to maneuver.  Thanks!

The steps needed to get a quote are not clear and it has taken to many emails back and forth to get a corrected quote.  My problem is still not solved and it is very difficult to manage these things during my planning time. I have had to send multiple emails.  In order to achieve my goal of getting a corrected quote.

The steps needed to get a quote are not clear and it has taken to many emails back and forth to get a corrected quote.  My problem is still not solved and it is very difficult to manage these things during my planning time. I have had to send multiple emails.  In order to achieve my goal of getting a corrected quote.
Marina was very patient and helpful!!
I have used Scholastic for MANY years! It's great!

I submitted a PO on 10/31 for 15 copies of Charlotte's Web.  On 11/1, I received an email asking for information that was included on the quote that was submitted with the PO.  After going back and forth several times, I was told the order could not be filled because the quote expired on 10/31 and the items are now not available.
Customer service was so fast and easy to work with! Love when a company makes me more endeared to them because of their super helpful employees!
Prompt response. Made it easy to determine book order fix.
Less of a time wait on the phone.
The last person who helped me was able to research the issue w/ my order and then helped w/ my request to cancel the order. I appreciated their help very much!
I appreciate you applying the monthly bonus which I forgot about before submitting my order!

I expressed the unavailability to those of use that order for our classroom. We have students in low income areas that do not order. Teachers are not unable to unlock bargain priced books unless students order.
Have a person that  can answer almost all questions.

I was asking about my board game being included in your catalog, and the individual who handled my emails didn't read anything I wrote, they then responded with inappropriate copy and paste responses which did NOT fit my inquiry.  It was disrespectful and disgusting.
They took immediate action to solve my issue.  Thank you so much!
Sheila was a great help and super friendly! I even emailed her after she helped me on the phone and she solved that problem too! She should get a raise! She was awesome!
Customer service was efficient and solved my problem right away. Very appreciated.

I didn't explain myself well. The representative was fine. It's just that I don't have parents ordering books. It is time away from my responsibilities that is challenging, and I do not have space for many more books right now, so I am not going to sacrifice my budget for more books right now. I hope that makes better sense. I love when students can have access to fun books to help them grow their reading skills. My responsibilities at school are tedious and take up a lot of my time, so much so that I don't have time to do everything. This is the place I need to let go. Thanks.

I may not have understood how this survey started.  I was disappointed in Scholastic, beicause I had an item missing from my order.  I emailed, and I was sent a response quickly.  I was told that a replacement item would be shiipped, but I have not received it as of yet.
I was able to get bonus points, since I sent in an order the day prior to receiving an email about 'sending in an order and getting some free bonus points."

We received a hardcover book (Three Billy Goats Gruff) whose jacket was badly damaged.  It appeared to have been shuffled around the warehouse for years!  Quality control should have absolutely never sent it out.  I have photos if you're interested.
I had to call about 10 times to try and get my problem resolved. Every employee I spoke to seemed very friendly and helpful but didn't actually fix the problem until this last phone call.
My account used to be someone elseâ€™s at our school, but she left. All I want to do is switch the names on the account.
The website could be more user friendly.
The response was very quick and detailed.

My issue was not fully addressed, Iâ€™m pretty sure that I will be emailing again. When parents order, their confirmation page says that their child attends Silver Valley and books will be shipped there. However, my account was updated at the end of the last school year and everything should say Queen Creek Elementary. I have shared the parent screen with customer service.
I was impressed with the quick response to my email!

I was told by your company that I would get my refund. Never got it. I have emailed and called your company and I am vet dissatisfied I will never order from your company again and wkont order for my child either .

In September I received emails alerting me to the fact that I had student orders waiting for me to process in my account. In October, I received NO ALERTS from Scholastic, so I almost missed them and I ordered a couple of days later than I had intended.

I am both a teacher and the Parents as Teacher Coordinator for my school district. When I place an order for books for PAT, the school district is charged tax. In August, a customer service representative told me to email our tax exempt certificate and request a refund. When I did that, I was asked to complete a separate form from Scholastic. The refund took 2 months to process. Recently, I received instructions that would "make things easier". The suggestion was to place the order and select pay by card and check. Then, pay the amount due with the credit card and not pay the tax amount. The instructions stated that amount would be credited back to my account. I followed those directions this morning and received an email saying that I had to wait until my order is shipped to request the tax refund. Everyone is busy and has a lot on their plates these days. It just seems like this could be so much easier. For example, once I have identified myself and provided the appropriate documents, it would be wonderful if I could "check a box" verifying that the order is being paid for with school funds and not be charged tax/have to request a refund. This might mean that I would place a separate order when I have students ordering, but that would be so much easier than multiple emails and providing documentation that could be kept on file. I have loved ordering from Scholastic for over 20 years as an educator. This is my first experience as a program coordinator and it has been more of a challenge than I expected.
always so prompt with a reply--such excellent customer service
Customer service team was very helpful
I got a respond quickly to my question and they were extremely helpful and accommodating
